I got the coal black (it's dark gray) and just ordered the green and dark brown corduroy. I'm only 5' 4" but I got the 4 tall (very tired of my pants all hitting above my ankle bone) and I like the length—they don't pool. I love the high rise and the waist fits me perfectly—I'm an hourglass and there is zero waist gap. Pants are surprisingly flattering and really comfortable. They look more like a straight than a barrel, but they look pulled together because of the slight taper at the bottom. These will be a new favorite.

I purchased size 35x34, measured the front rise at 12.75" (sits pretty high which I like), leg opening 8.75", thigh 14.0" across leg right at crotch, and knee 10.75", waistband 37.0" (typical +2" vanity sizing). BR's description of their Authentic Straight fit states it's more relaxed than their Straight fit, and this is def the case in the thighs and knees which are fairly baggy (the measurements reflect this). In my opinion, the fit is a clear departure from a 1950s/james dean kind of straight fit, nodding more toward baggy fits that are currently on trend. Although I found the legs to be baggier than my preference, the top block looked conventionally nice...didn't find the seat or hip area to be too big or saggy. The denim fabric is very good and there is a understated, simple elegance to the jeans with no logos or loud stitching. The rear leather patch is even plain with no logo or text, and the front metal button just says "1978" in very small text. I returned them bc the baggier fit isn't what I'm looking for, but it's a well-made product and I will try BRs regular Straight fit (non Authentic Straight) next time.
great pair of pants. will likely be great for winter as the material is a bit heavy.
Great fit and design. Perfect complement with chinos.

The pants can be dressed up to wear to dinner with a blouse or worn to the farmers market with a cute tee and a pair of sandals or worn with a tank top and sneakers to a baseball game. The slacks are made from quality linen that is breathable and airy. The only thing to note is they are a little shorter on me then in the photo and I am 5'8" but still a good length on me. I did order the long also just in case I did not like the length. I kept the regular length and exchanged the long for another pair of the regular length in a different color.

I'm pretty skinny (29x32 size) but the athletic fit still hugged my thighs and crotch area uncomfortably. I have a pair of athletic traveler pants in the exact same size which fit fine, so the inconsistent sizing is pretty disappointing.

I bought the Agustin Relaxed Linen-Blend Pant in Tanin brown for my fiancé, and they turned out to be the perfect choice! He tends to run hot, but the linen-blend material is so breathable and lightweight that he stays comfortable all day, even in warmer weather. The relaxed fit and high-quality fabric keep him cool without sacrificing style. Whether he's pairing them with a dress shirt for an evening out or a casual tee for a more laid-back look, these pants always look polished. The Tanin brown color is a great neutral that adds a sophisticated touch to his wardrobe. We couldn't be happier with this purchase!
